data.title: Coko of SWV 'Clap Your Hands'
data.meta_description: Coko best know for her work with SWV singing 90s classics like 'Right Here', 'I'm So Into You, the number #1 Pop and R'n'B Single 'Weak', 'You're The One' and 'Rain'  this talented soprano with
data.text:
Post by perfecto on

Coko best know for her work with SWV singing 90s classics like 'Right Here', 'I'm So Into You, the number #1 Pop and R'n'B Single 'Weak', 'You're The One' and 'Rain'

this talented soprano with her distinctive honey glazed voice is releasing her first single 'clap your hands' from her new album 'grateful' the song goes to radio this week...what do you guys think of it? i love it, it is really uplifting i really miss her voice and am glad she is back its about time!!

preview the new track here...

nuthinbutgospel.com/musicroom.htm

check out coko's myspace with exclusive unreleased tracks...

profile.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=user.viewprofile&friendID=54011891

Post by perfecto on

SWV have reformed and working on new material they have been touring this year

check this live performance of 'weak' there are other too like 'rain' on youtube....

youtube.com/watch?v=4RDt4yj3Q1k&search=swv

taj is still looking after her new baby and can't commit full time to the busy life in a group yet!!

SWV will be coming back after Coko's new album, you guys remember how triflin RCA was they didn't release Coko's 'Music Doll' cause they closed down their urban market WTF!!

remember LL Cool J 'Amazin' this was actually Coko's song called 'Amazing Love' produced by pharrell the chorus is from her song but it was reused with added rapping, in fact get this if you listen very closely to the background vocals in some parts of the song you can make out Coko's voice the best part of that song was the singing!!

anyway Coko has launched her website its got a HQ preview version of 'Clap Your Hands'

WWW.COKOSPLACE.COM

Post by perfecto on

thanks clem for the link!! we got a definate date now impacting radio

august 7th can't wait for the response!!

her voice is distinctive you know when you turn the radio on its her right away, mary mary don't have that certain youthful urban vibrance in their voices like coko has, i prefer coko's voice it has more personality

i think this song and her album will be successful for her and she has influenced so many female r'n'b female groups/singers since she came out in 1992 with SWV people will support her

i hope they make remixes maybe a resung version too?? Coko/SWV were know for doing remixes remember 'anything' the uptempo version with a rare guest appearance by Wu Tang, 'You're The One' Allstar Remix still sounds so good today!! you guys heard the unreleased 'triflin' swizz beats remix??

Post by perfecto on

i hope its by a superproducer she has worked with timbaland, neptunes and darkchild in the past, she has credibilty among the people that know about R'n'B and this could get HUGE for her

but i don't mind as long as they do a good job...

mikecheck12 keep us updated!!

Post by marcjm on

This does sorta sound like a Mary Mary track, but she has a different vocal style and approach which brings a new definition to the song. I'm feeling it because this girl can blow. I hope that Urban wakes up and accepts this joint.

Post by perfecto on

more news is emerging about the album its got production by Warryn "Baby Dubb" Campbell, super producer Rodney Jerkins, and J. Moss & PAJAM, 'clap your hands' is darkchild production? Lil' mo and faith evans feature plus kirk franklin, i like the sound of this they are balancing the gospel and r'n'b
